member.name: T:Dawnsbury.Auxiliary.GamePhase
member.summary: An abstract class that represents a layer of UI. These layers ("phases") are stacked on top of each other. All of them get drawn, but only the top one gets updated.

member.summary: Virtual method. Override this to perform drawing this phase. The base method will draw all UIElements of this phase. This method will be called regardless of whether this phase is on top of the stack.
member.param: The spriteBatch to use. The method assumes the spriteBatch is already Begun.
The game.
Seconds elapsed since last draw cycle.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Auxiliary.GamePhase.Update(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game,System.Single)
member.summary: Virtual method. Override this to perform updates in this phase. This method will only be called if this phase is on top of stack. The base method causes all UI Elements in the UIElement list to update.
member.param: The game.
Seconds elapsed since last update cycle.

member.summary: Performs any destruction code, then causes the phase to be flagged for removal from stack. Base method causes this by setting the ScheduledForElimination flag.
member.param: The game.

member.summary: Gets the creature's information about weaknesses, resistances and hardness. A creature's weaknesses, resistances and hardness are fully recalculated at each state check.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.BaseArmor
member.summary: Gets the actual physical armor that the player character is wearing, if any. Monsters don't have base armor.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Armor
member.summary: Gets information about the creature's current armor-derived values, recalculated at each state check. These values may be modified by qeffects with . This is only meaningful for creatures that have character sheets.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.AnimationData
member.summary: Gets information about animations currently affecting this creature.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.AI
member.summary: Gets the tactics of how this creature should value actions when it's computer-controlled.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Illustration
member.summary: Gets or sets the creature token's illustration.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Battle
member.summary: Gets the battle for which this instance was spawned.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.BaseName
member.summary: Gets the original name of this creature, without the and without adjustments, such as "Orc Warrior".

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.MainName
member.summary: Gets the pure name of this creature, without the , such as "Elite Orc Warrior".

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Distinguisher
member.summary: Gets the name distinguisher in case there are multiple creatures with the same name on the battlefield ('A', 'B', ...).

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Name
member.summary: Gets the full display name of this creature, such as "Elite Orc Warrior A".

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.OwningFaction
member.summary: Gets the faction that controls this creature, such as "You" (= Player) or "Enemy".

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Occupies
member.summary: Gets the tile this creature is currently standing on.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Damage
member.summary: Gets the total amount of damage currently marked on this creature.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Actions
member.summary: Gets historical information about any actions this creature has already taken, as well as the number of actions and reactions currently available to it.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.InitiativeControlledBy
member.summary: This creature doesn't have its own place in the initiative order unless it's dying. If it isn't dying, its initiative is controlled by the creature referenced in this property.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.TurnInformation
member.summary: Gets information about the turns this creature has taken, is taking or is about to take.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.DrainedMaxHPDecrease
member.summary: Maximum HP lost due to being drained or from suffering from mummy rot or other conditions. This is an ephemeral property recalculated each state-check.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.MaxHP
member.summary: Gets or sets the creature's maximum Hit Points, before considering any temporary changes to Max HP, such as from Drained.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.MaxHPMinusDrained
member.summary: Gets the creature's HP, reduced by a decrease from the Drained condition.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Proficiencies
member.summary: Gets the creature's proficiencies.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.TemporaryHP
member.summary: Gets the amount of temporary HP this creature has.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.HP
member.summary: Gets the creature's current HP.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.QEffects
member.summary: Gets the QEffects currently owned by this creature. To remove a QEffect from this creature, set its to so that it's cleared at the next state-check, or call .

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.HeldItems
member.summary: Gets the zero, one or two items that the creature is currently holding in its hands.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.UnarmedStrike
member.summary: Gets or sets the creature's primary melee unarmed strike that the creature uses to make attacks of opportunity if it doesn't have any weapons. A creature may have additional unarmed strikes given by any QEffects it owns with .

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.PrimaryItem
member.summary: Gets the item the creature is holding in its left (primary) hand, or any two-handed item it's holding, if any.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.SecondaryItem
member.summary: Gets the item the creature is holding in its right hand, if any.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.CarriedItems
member.summary: Gets the items the creature is keeping in its backpack.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.HasFreeHand
member.summary: Returns true if the creature has at least one free hand.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Skills
member.summary: Gets the creature's skills.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.DetectionStatus
member.summary: Gets the creature's Undetected/Detected flag, as well as information about who it's Hidden from.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Level
member.summary: Gets the creature's level.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.ProficiencyLevel
member.summary: Gets the creature's level for the purposes of calculating its proficiency.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Perception
member.summary: Gets the creature's Perception bonus.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.BaseSpeed
member.summary: Gets the creature's base speed, before modification by armor and QEffects.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Speed
member.summary: Gets the creature's current Speed.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.InitiativeBonus
member.summary: Gets the creature's calculated bonus to initiative.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Possibilities
member.summary: Gets the creature's current possibilities. All creatures have possibilities, but the possibilities of nonactive creatures are expired and no longer reflect the current state, and are used only for display of (stale) rules stat blocks.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Traits
member.summary: Gets the creature's traits.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Defenses
member.summary: Gets the creature's saves, AC and other possible DCs, such as skill DCs and Perception DC.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.SpawnAsGaia
member.summary: This creature should be spawned onto the map as belonging to Gaia () -- grey inanimate unaligned s.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.SpawnAsHumanControlled
member.summary: This creature should be spawned onto the map as belonging to the player ().

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.SpawnAsFriends
member.summary: This creature should be spawned onto the map as belonging to Friends () -- yellow allies.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.VisibleToHumanPlayer
member.summary: Returns true if this creature should be drawn on the battlemap.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Initiative
member.summary: Gets the final initiative count of this creature, including both Perception and the initiative d20 roll. A creature's initiative changes as it delays or as it's moved if it becomes Dying.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Abilities
member.summary: Gets the creature's ability ability modifiers. Creatures don't have ability scores, only character sheets do.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Spellcasting
member.summary: Gets information about the creature's spellcasting, such as its number of focus points, spell slots and spells prepared.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.IsLivingCreature
member.summary: Returns true if this creature counts as a living creature for the purposes of targeting.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Subtitle
member.summary: Gets the creature's title as it should appear during cutscenes (for example, "Mentor of the Dawnsbury Four").

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.DoesNotSpeakCommon
member.summary: Returns true if this creature doesn't speak Common and so player characters take a -4 penalty to Demoralize it.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.PersistentCharacterSheet
member.summary: Gets the creature's character sheet if the creature represents a player character, otherwise returns null. During gameplay, a creature's character sheet is immutable.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.PersistentUsedUpResources
member.summary: During adventure path mode, gets the holder object that's kept in the savefile and maintains the list of exhausted resources of a character, such as spells used, once-per-day abilities used etc.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.MaximumSpellRank
member.summary: Gets the maximum spell level that this creature could cast if it were a spellcaster, so, "1" if it's level 2 or less; "2" if it's level 3 or 4, etc. This is also known as "half your level, rounded up".

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Impulsing
member.summary: Gets information about the creature's kineticist impulses.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.CreatureId
member.summary: Identifies this creature's type which can be used by some cinematics or effects.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.ReplacementUnarmedStrike
member.summary: Ephemeral, and reset at every state check. You can set this property to an unarmed strike to replace the creature's basic unarmed strike with this one.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.ReplacementIllustration
member.summary: Ephemeral, and reset at every state check. You can set this property to an illustration to replace a creature's portrait.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Die
member.summary: Plays the death sound and overhead, triggers and schedules this creature to be destroyed at next state-check.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.DeathScheduledForNextStateCheck
member.summary: Indicates that this creature has received lethal damage and is scheduled to be removed from the initiative order and the list of creature at next state check.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.AddQEffect(Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect)
member.summary: Adds a new QEffect to this creature.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.FriendOf(Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature)
member.summary: Returns true if this creature is seen as a friend by .

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.FriendOfAndNotSelf(Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature)
member.summary: Returns true if this creature is seen as as a friend by and this isn't that creature.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.EnemyOf(Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature)
member.summary: Returns true if this creature is seen as an enemy by .

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.MakeStrike(Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature,Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Treasure.Item,System.Int32)
member.summary: Makes a free Strike against the TARGET with the given WEAPON at MULTIPLE ATTACK PENALTY (or -1 to use the current multiple attack penalty).

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.PrimaryWeapon
member.summary: Gets the weapon in the creature's leftmost hand that has a melee weapon, or the creature's basic unarmed attack if it doesn't wield a melee weapon, or null if the creature has neither a melee weapon nor a basic unarmed attack. A weapon that you can't use because of a monk mandatory stance can't be a primary weapon.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.PrimaryWeaponIncludingRanged
member.summary: Gets the weapon in the creature's leftmost hand that has any weapon, including ranged weapon, or the creature's unarmed attack otherwise, or null if the creature has neither.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.MeleeWeapons
member.summary: Gets the items you can currently use as melee weapons. These are your actual weapons, your additional unarmed strikes, and your main unarmed strike (even if you don't have a hand free, in which case it's converted into a kick).

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Weapons
member.summary: Gets the items you can currently use for Striking. These are your actual weapons, your additional unarmed strikes, and your main unarmed strike (even if you don't have a hand free, in which case it's converted into a kick). This includes ranged weapons.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.PushCreature(Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature,System.Int32)
member.summary: Pushes the target creature away from this creature the specified number of squares.
member.param: The creature that should be pushed.
The number of squares it should move.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.PullCreature(Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature)
member.summary: Pulls the target creature towards this creature the specified number of squares.
member.param: The creature that should be pulled.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.StrideAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Dawnsbury.Core.Tiles.Tile,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Causes the creature's owner to choose a tile to Stride to and this creature to Stride there. This Stride is a subaction and doesn't expend any actions. Returns true if a stride was executed. Returns false if the Stride was canceled.
member.param: Full text to display in the topbar while the owner is choosing a tile to Stride to.
If true and the owner selects a steppable tile, the creature will Step in there instead of Striding in there.
If not null, then this Stride must Stride towards this tile.
If true, then the user can right-click to abort the stride, in which case 'false' will be returned from this method..
If true, then the user can choose to pass on the stride in which case 'false' will be returned from this method.
If true, then the user can move at maximum half its land speed.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.CarriesItem(Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Treasure.ItemName)
member.summary: Returns true if this creature has an item with the given in its hands or its backpack.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.WieldsItem(Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait)
member.summary: Returns true if this creature holds an item with the given trait in its hands.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.IsWeaponUser
member.summary: Indicates that this creature started this combat with a weapon in hand, and is thus used to using weapons.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.Alive
member.summary: True if this creature is a functioning threat to its enemies.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.AliveOrUnconscious
member.summary: True if this creature is still a legitimate target of post-damage choices, because it's not about to be removed from the game soon.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.LongTermEffects
member.summary: If this creature is a campaign hero, then at end of combat, you can add long-term effects resulting from the combat here.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.DescriptionFulltext
member.summary: If not null, then the full statblock of this creature is replaced by this string instead of being calculated from abilities, attacks etc.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.IsNamedMonster
member.summary: If true, then this monster's name is a proper name ("The Final Death" or "The Inevitable Death") rather than a descriptor ("Orc Warrior", "Brimorak") and so shouldn't be modified to say "Weak" or "Elite" and such.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.DieFastAndWithoutAnimation
member.summary: Performs an accelerated death sequence: Kills the target without an overhead, runs on-death state-check events of this creature, removes it from the game, and then skips the opacity-decreasing animation.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.WithFeat(Dawnsbury.Core.CharacterBuilder.Feats.FeatName)
member.summary: Adds the given feat to this monster creature. Warning! The creature still doesn't have a character sheet so you must only add feats to creatures that don't make use of the character sheet in their block.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.SetDamageImmediately(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets this creature's to be and cancels all damage animations.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.AskToUseReaction(System.String)
member.summary: Asks the controller of this creature if they want to take a reaction in response to an event. The AI will always choose to take a reaction. If this creature can't currently take reactions, this returns false.
member.param: Text of the dialog box.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.AskToUseReaction(System.String,Dawnsbury.Display.Illustrations.Illustration)
member.summary: Asks the controller of this creature if they want to take a reaction in response to an event. The AI will always choose to take a reaction. If this creature can't currently take reactions, this returns false. Uses the given illustration as
member.param: Text of the dialog box.
Illustration to appear in the dialog box instead of the reaction icon.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.AskForConfirmation(Dawnsbury.Display.Illustrations.Illustration,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Asks the controller of this creature to confirm an optional effect. If the controller is AI, it will always choose to confirm.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.AskForChoiceAmongButtons(Dawnsbury.Display.Illustrations.Illustration,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Asks the controller of this creature to make a choice from among the given options. If the controller is AI, it will always choose the first option.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.GetQEffectValue(Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId)
member.summary: If this creature has a QEffect with the given ID, returns its value. If not, returns zero.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.FindQEffect(Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId)
member.summary: Efficiently finds a QEffect with the given ID on this creature if there is one, or returns null if not.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature.CanTakeTrainedOnlyActions(Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait)
member.summary: Returns true if this creature is at least trained in the given skill, or has some ability to take trained actions in this skill even though it isn't trained in this skill.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Faction.IsGaia
member.summary: This factions is either or .

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Faction.IsGaiaFriends
member.summary: This faction is the green "friends" faction, such as Roderick or Morning Dewdrop.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Faction.IsGaiaPure
member.summary: This faction is the grey objects faction.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Faction.IsPlayer

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Faction.IsEnemy
member.summary: This faction is the red enemy faction.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Faction.IsControlledByHumanUser
member.summary: This faction is the Dawnsbury Four ( is true), or it's the enemy faction and GM mode is enabled.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Parts.WeaknessAndResistance.ImmunityToCriticalHits
member.summary: This creature is immune to critical hits. [persistent status]

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Parts.WeaknessAndResistance.ImmunityToForcedMovement
member.summary: This creature is immune to being pushed. [persistent status]

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Parts.WeaknessAndResistance.GetAndApplyResistance(Dawnsbury.Core.CombatActions.CombatAction,Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.DamageKind,System.Int32)
member.summary: Applies resistance to the given DAMAGE KIND so that it doesn't apply to future damage events in the same action, up to an amount equal to MAXIMUM USEFUL RESISTANCE. Returns the amount of resistance that was actually applied.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Parts.WeaknessAndResistance.WhatDamageKindIsBestAgainstMe(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.DamageKind})
member.summary: Returns the damage kind from those listed that would be the most efficient against this creature, that is to say, it would trigger the greatest vulnerability, or if there is no vulnerabilities, would trigger the least resistance, and would not trigger any immunities.
member.param: The best damage kind against this creature will be selected from these kinds.

member.name: T:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Spellcasting
member.summary: Contains information about the creature's spellcasting, such as its number of focus points, spell slots and spells prepared. A creature that isn't a spellcaster doesn't have an instance of this class.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Spellcasting.Self
member.summary: Gets the creature owning this instance.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Spellcasting.Sources
member.summary: Gets the list of sources that grant this creature spells. For example, a wizard with a cleric archetype would have a "Wizard" source and a "Cleric" source. The first source in this list is called the primary source. Each spellcaster always has at least one source.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Spellcasting.FocusPoints
member.summary: Gets or set the number of focus points of this creature.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Spellcasting.FocusPointsMaximum
member.summary: Gets or set the maximum number of focus points that this creature can have.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Spellcasting.PrimarySpellcastingSource
member.summary: Gets the primary spellcasting source of this creature. You should probably not used this property. It exists mostly to account for old save files, which store used up resources globally for a creature instead of per class.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Spellcasting.GetSourceByOrigin(Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait)
member.summary: Gets the spellcasting source that corresponds to the given class, if any.
member.returns: Spellcasting source given by the given class if this creature has it, or null otherwise.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Spellcasting.UseUpSpellcastingResources(Dawnsbury.Core.CombatActions.CombatAction)
member.summary: Causes this creature to consume spell slots or focus points, as demanded by the .

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Spellcasting.RevertExpendingOfResources(Dawnsbury.Core.CombatActions.CombatAction)
member.summary: Causes this creature to regain spell slots or focus points that were previously consumed by the .

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.SpellcastingKind.Prepared
member.summary: This source uses prepared spellcasting.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.SpellcastingKind.Spontaneous
member.summary: This source uses spontaneous spellcasting.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.SpellcastingKind.Innate
member.summary: This source uses prepared innate spellcasting.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.SpellcastingKind.Legacy
member.summary: Do not use this.

member.name: T:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.SpellcastingSource
member.summary: Represents all spells granted to this creature by a single source. That source can be a class, a multiclass archetype or innate. All spells have a source.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.SpellcastingSource.SpellcastingAbility
member.summary: Gets or sets the spellcasting ability used by this source.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.SpellcastingSource.SpellcastingTradition
member.summary: Gets or sets the spellcasting tradition of this source (, , or ).

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.SpellcastingSource.ClassOfOrigin
member.summary: Gets the class trait of the class that is the origin of this source. If this source represents innate spells, use . If this source represents ancestry spells, you can use the trait of that ancestry. This will be displayed to the user in the spellcasting menu if the creature has more than one spellcasting source.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.SpellcastingSource.Kind
member.summary: Whether this source is prepared, spontaneous or innate. Innate spellcasting works like prepared spellcasting.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.GameLoop.NewStateCheckRequired
member.summary: If true, it means that at the end of the state check, this will be set to false and another state-check will immediately begin. State-check effects can set this to turn when they changed something and require the full state-check to rerun.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Intelligence.AI.OverrideDecision
member.summary: If this AI must choose between THE CALCULATED SET OF ALL OPTIONS, it should choose the returned option instead of using its normal usefulness comparer. If you return null, then the normal usefulness comparer will be used.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Intelligence.Tactic.Standard
member.summary: The creature chooses the best combat action, preferring to attack twice and move once, and the creature makes use of flanking.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Intelligence.Tactic.Mindless
member.summary: The creature moves towards the closest enemy and Strikes it.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Intelligence.Tactic.PackAttack
member.summary: The creature uses tactics, except that it prefer to be adjacent to creature within reach of allies.

member.name: T:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Core.ActiveRollSpecification
member.summary: An active roll specification determines what kind of roll the owner of an action must make against each target.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Core.ActiveRollSpecification.DetermineBonus
member.summary: Returns the calculated attack or non-attack bonus to this d20 roll, when the ACTION's OWNER takes the action against the TARGET CREATURE(nullable).

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Core.ActiveRollSpecification.DetermineDC
member.summary: Returns the calculated DC that the active roll must hit or exceed when the ACTION's OWNER takes the action against the TARGET CREATURE.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Core.ActiveRollSpecification.#ctor(Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Core.CalculatedNumber.CalculatedNumberProducer,Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Core.CalculatedNumber.CalculatedNumberProducer)
member.summary: An active roll specification determines what kind of roll the owner of an action must make against each target.
member.param: Returns the calculated attack or non-attack bonus to this d20 roll, when the ACTION's OWNER takes the action against the TARGET CREATURE(nullable).
Returns the calculated DC that the active roll must hit or exceed when the ACTION's OWNER takes the action against the TARGET CREATURE.

member.name: T:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Core.Bonus
member.summary: Represents a flat numerical modifier to a numerical value.

member.name: T:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Core.CalculatedActiveRoll
member.summary: A calculated active roll represents an attack roll, a skill check roll, or other roll that the owner of an action makes, usually against a specific target, with all bonuses already calculated in.

member.name: T:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Damage.DamageEvent
member.summary:
Damage can only ultimately be dealt as a damage event (a.k.a. an instance of damage). In Dawnsbury Days, a damage event is the result of a single damage roll (possibly modified by effects) against a single creature as part of a single, possibly subordinate, action.
For example, a Strike always results in only a single damage event, even if the damage is modified by additional fire or alignment damage. A spell that deals fire and good damage at to the same creature creates a single damage event, but if it does so to multiple creatures, then those creatures each have separate damage events.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Damage.DamageEvent.CombatAction
member.summary: The action that created the bulk of the damage. It must have an owner, who is the source of the damage.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Damage.DamageEvent.Source
member.summary: The creature that dealt this damage.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Damage.DamageEvent.CheckResult
member.summary: Check result of the main check of the that dealt this damage, specifically the check made with regards to this target.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Damage.DamageEvent.TargetCreature
member.summary: The creature that's being dealt damage by this damage event.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Damage.DamageEvent.KindedDamages
member.summary: Gets the parts that compose the damage event, each likely with a different damage type. The list as well as each element is mutable; and the individual elements may also change as the event is being dealt.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Damage.DamageEvent.DoubleDamage
member.summary: If true, then should be doubled before being dealt.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Damage.DamageEvent.HalveDamage
member.summary: If true, then should be halved before being dealt.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Damage.DamageEvent.IsSplashDamage
member.summary: This damage event represents splash damage and shouldn't be increased by effects that increase damage.

member.summary: List of bonuses to the damage to apply before critical hit/save modifications.

member.summary: Gets or sets the additional dice formula that is added only if the damage instance comes from a critical hit (on an attack) or a critical failure (on a save).

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Damage.KindedDamage.ResolvedDamage
member.summary: This is the final damage value, after rolls, resolved during damage resolution. It is set after resistances apply, and it is dealt shortly afterwards.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Damage.KindedDamage.ApplyCriticalAndHalvingEffects
member.summary: Indicates whether a critical hit should multiply this damage and a save should halve it.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Damage.KindedDamage.AddPostCriticalDamage(Dawnsbury.Core.Roller.DiceFormula)
member.summary: Adds extra damage to be dealt only if the damage instance comes from a critical hit (on an attack) or a critical failure (on a save).

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.RerollDirection.KeepRollButRedoCalculation
member.summary: The number rolled on the d20 will stay, but what counts as a success or failure will be recalculated from the state as it exists now, which may include additional bonuses or penalties now existing on some creatures. This is not a fortune effect.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.RerollDirection.RerollAndKeepBest
member.summary: The d20 result will be rerolled, and the final result will be whichever result is higher. The probabilities bar will also be recalculated. This is a fortune effect.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.RerollDirection.RerollAndKeepSecond
member.summary: The d20 result will be rerolled, and the final result will be the second result. The probabilities bar will also be recalculated. This is a fortune effect.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.RerollDirection.DoNothing
member.summary: This effect does not modify the d20 check.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.None
member.summary: This special value, which is zero, represents no trait and should be used instead of a nullable Trait?.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.Basic
member.summary: A combat action with this trait doesn't show up in the rules block under the "OFFENSE" section. Usually, you want to add this trait to all combat actions that are generated by QEffects that have their own description, to avoid duplicating information. Alternately, if the description is too long, you can omit the Basic trait but instead use to set the rules block description for that action which will take precedence in the rules block over the full description.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.SustainASpell
member.summary: An action with this trait causes a spell to remain active even though it would normally expire.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.Uncommon
member.summary: This spell cannot be placed on a scroll, prepared or selected as a standard spell. It's probably a focus spell or otherwise an unavailable spell.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.Club
member.summary: This means the weapon group "club".

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.Worn
member.summary: This item is a worn item and has its effect in your inventory, and can't be in your hand.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.AlwaysHits
member.summary: This action is unaffected by concealment, and ignores its active specification roll.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.ProxyAttack
member.summary: This is an action by a Spiritual Weapon or the like.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.IsNotHostile
member.summary: This combat action doesn't count as a hostile action for the purposes of effects like Invisibility and Sanctuary, even though it targets an enemy.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.IsHostile
member.summary: This combat action counts as a hostile action for the purposes of effects like Invisibility and Sanctuary, even if it doesn't target an enemy.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.DoesNotBreakStealth
member.summary: This combat action doesn't break stealth even though it isn't a Sneak.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.AttackDoesNotTargetAC
member.summary: This trait is pointless now and shouldn't be used anymore. Whether an attack targets AC is now determined through TaggedChecks.DefenseDC in the ActiveRollSpecification.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.SpecificMagicWeapon
member.summary: This technical trait, when attached to a weapon, means that the system should not attempt to create a +1 version of it, or a +1 striking version of it, and that runes can't be attached to the weapon or unattached from the weapon manually, and are instead an integral part of it.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.UnaffectedByConcealment
member.summary: A with this technical trait does not ever ask for a miss chance check due to concealment.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.Gloves
member.summary: Body part for the purposes of .

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.Shoes
member.summary: Body part for the purposes of .

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.Mask
member.summary: Body part for the purposes of .

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.MultipleWorn
member.summary: You can wear multiple of these items and they will all work.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.ItemUsableOncePerDay
member.summary: If an action is executed with this item as its , then this item will get the "used up" modification.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.AttackDoesNotIncreaseMultipleAttackPenalty
member.summary: This combat action does not increase the multiple attack penalty on itself, even if it's an .

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.Legacy

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.TrueClub
member.summary: This weapon is the literal weapon "club".

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.BattleformAttack

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.Unsellable
member.summary: This item can't be sold to the shop from your inventory in story mode.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.UnimportantForVictoryCondition
member.summary: If only enemies with this trait remain, it still counts as though you defeated all enemies.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.BypassesOutOfCombat
member.summary: This action can be used against creatures that are out-of-combat.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.Restraining
member.summary: This action may cause the target to become grabbed or restrained.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.NonInscribable

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.NonSummonable

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.Counteract

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.Trait.SpellLikeAbility

member.name: T:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.TraitProperties
member.summary: Contains additional information about a trait.

member.summary: Gets the human-readable name of this trait.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.TraitProperties.Relevant
member.summary: If true, then this trait will be shown to the player as normal. If false, then this is a hidden technical trait.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.TraitProperties.RulesText
member.summary: Some traits are displayed in stat blocks, especially item traits of weapons and armors, and this text is the text that's displayed.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.TraitProperties.IsAncestryTrait
member.summary: True if this trait represents an ancestry. s that have an ancestry trait automatically gain a prerequisite that the character must be of that ancestry and gain the technical trait.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.TraitProperties.IsClassTrait
member.summary: True if this trait represents a class. s that have a class trait automatically gain a prerequisite that the character must have that class and gain the technical trait.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.TraitProperties.IsElementTrait
member.summary: True if this trait represent a kineticist element.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.TraitProperties.ProficiencyName
member.summary: If this trait represents something you can be proficient in, such as a specific weapon or a weapon group, then this is the human-readable name of that proficiency such as "Elven weapons" or "Heavy crossbow".

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.TraitProperties.RelevantForShortBlock
member.summary: If true, then this trait will be shown to the player also when it's a trait attached to a combat action. This is usually for traits like "agile" or "sweep".

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.TraitProperties.RelevantOnlyForClass
member.summary: If not , then this trait only shows up on combat actions that are owned by a member of this class (e.g. school traits for the wizard, or Concentrate for the barbarian).

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.TraitProperties.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.param: The human-readable name of this trait.
If true, then this trait will be shown to the player as normal. If false, then this is a hidden technical trait.
Some traits are displayed in stat blocks, especially item traits of weapons and armors, and this text is the text that's displayed. Most traits don't need any rules text description.
If true, then this trait will be shown to the player also when it's a trait attached to a combat action. This is usually for traits like "agile" or "sweep".

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.ExpirationCondition.Never
member.summary: Doesn't expire on its own.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.ExpirationCondition.Ephemeral
member.summary: Expires at next state-check.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.ExpirationCondition.CountsDownAtEndOfYourTurn
member.summary: The qeffect's value decreases by 1 at end of sufferer's turn, and if it decreases to 0, the qeffect is removed.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.ExpirationCondition.Immediately
member.summary: Expires at next iteration of the state-check loop, or at next state-check if not currently in a state-check.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.ExpirationCondition.ExpiresAtEndOfSourcesTurn
member.summary: Expires at the end of the source's turn.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.ExpirationCondition.CountsDownAtStartOfSourcesTurn
member.summary: The qeffect's value decreased by 1 at the beginning of the source's turn, and if it decreases to 0, the qeffect is removed. This only decreases at the start of a primary turn.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.ExpirationCondition.EphemeralAtEndOfImmediateAction
member.summary: Expires at the end of the current combat action, even if it's part of a greater action.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.ExpirationCondition.ExpiresAtStartOfSourcesTurn
member.summary: Expires at the beginning of the source's turn (possibly after a specified number of rounds). This only expires or counts down at the start of primary turns.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.ExpirationCondition.ExpiresAtEndOfYourTurn
member.summary: Expires at the end of the sufferer's turn.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.Id
member.summary: Some but far from all QEffects have an Id with special meaning.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.Illustration
member.summary: Gets or set the icon of this qeffect.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ExpiresAt
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration of this QEffect.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.CannotExpireThisTurn
member.summary: Determines whether this QEffect cannot expire this turn. If this is true and is or and this is the source's or owner's turn, then at the end of the turn, this will be set to false instead of the qeffect expiring. This is used to implement the expiration period "until the end of your next turn".

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.Name
member.summary: The pure name of this qeffect. QEffects don't need a name if they're technical qeffects not meant to be displayed.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.NameWithValue
member.summary: Display name of this qeffect, including its if any.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.Description
member.summary: Tooltip for this qeffect to be shown when hovering over its icon, or to be shown in the stat block if this qeffect is .

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AppliedThisStateCheck
member.summary: During each state-check, each QEffect's and delegates will happen exactly once, even if the state-check repeats. This property keeps track of whether this qeffect applied during this state-check.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.Hidden
member.summary: If true, the effect is not displayed as an icon and is not displayed in the card.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.HideFromPortrait
member.summary: If true, then this long-term effect shouldn't display as a small icon on top of the portrait.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.Tag
member.summary: Arbitrary data relevant to this specific qeffect that the qeffect can use as it likes.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.UsedThisTurn
member.summary: A QEffect can store information here on whether it was used this turn or not. This property is automatically reset to false when a creature's turn begins.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.SubsumedBy
member.summary: If the owner of this effect also has one of these qeffects, then this qeffect is not displayed as an icon.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.Innate
member.summary: This effect is a creature trait or character ability.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.Key
member.summary: This effect doesn't stack. If two effects with this same key apply to the same creature, only the one with the greater value prevails. If they have the same value, the newer one prevails.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.QuickenedFor
member.summary: This creature is quickened and if it can use the extra action for the COMBAT ACTION, this returns true.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.Value
member.summary: Some conditions have a value. If this QEffect represents such a condition, then this is that value.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.Source
member.summary: Gets the creature that is the origin of this effect. Not all QEffects have a source.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.SourceAction
member.summary: Gets the action/spell that creates this effect. Nullable! The vast majority of QEffects do not show the source action in this property.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.Owner
member.summary: Gets the creature that is suffering this effect, and has it in its list.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.RoundsLeft
member.summary: If this qeffect's is measured in rounds, then this is the number of rounds that are left.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ReferencedSpell
member.summary: If this effect is a , then this is the spell that it sustains.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.YouDealDamageWithStrike
member.summary: After you successfully Strike with COMBAT ACTION, about to deal DICE FORMULA damage to the DEFENDER, this happens and you instead deal the returned DICE FORMULA damage.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.YouDealDamageWithStrike2
member.summary: After you successfully Strike with COMBAT ACTION, about to deal KINDED DAMAGE as main damage to the DEFENDER, this happens, and in this, you may adjust the mutable kinded damage.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AdditionalGoodness
member.summary: If you take a COMBAT ACTION against a DEFENDER, then that combat action will gain extra additional goodness.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ImmuneToTrait
member.summary: This creature is utterly unaffected by combat actions with this trait. Do not use the setter; instead use QEffect.TraitImmunity().WithExpirationEphemeral(), that will cause the immunity to also appear in the stat block.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.OverrideItemDamageDie
member.summary: Returns the actual dice size that a WEAPON should use when making a Strike with STRIKE MODIFIERS instead of its normal weapon damage die when making a Strike.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.IncreaseItemDamageDie
member.summary: Returns true if the damage die of the given ITEM should be increased by one step. Multiple effects of this kind are cumulative.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.IncreaseItemDamageDieCount
member.summary: Returns true if the number of damage dice of the given ITEM should be increased by one.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.IncreaseSpellEffectDamageDie
member.summary: Returns true if all damage dice of the given SPELL OR IMPULSE's damage roll which deals DAMAGE-KIND damage should be increased by one step.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.YouAreDealtDamage
member.summary: Just before the ATTACKER deals DAMAGE STUFF to DEFENDER, this happens. This creature is the defender. This happens after weakness and resistance applies. You should return any modification you want to make, or null.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.YouAreDealtLethalDamage
member.summary: Just before the ATTACKER deals DAMAGE STUFF to DEFENDER, this happens. This creature is the defender. This happens after weakness and resistance applies, and after any other effects apply, and only if the damage would reduce your HP from a value higher than 0 to 0. You should return any modification you want to make, or null. This doesn't trigger if you're already at 0 HP (this is a reversal of functionality in version 2.58).

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BonusToAllSpeeds
member.summary: Returns a bonus or penalty that applies to all of your Speeds, in squares.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.YouAcquireQEffect
member.summary: Whenever a new QEFFECT is added to you, instead the returned QEffect is added to you. If you return null, no new QEffect is added to you.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.StartOfYourTurn
member.summary: Happens at the beginning of your action phase in your turn.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.StartOfYourPrimaryTurn
member.summary: Happens at the beginning of your primary turn. (You only have one primary turn per combat round.) Use this for once-per-round triggers, scripted conversations, environmental damage. For most effects, you'll want to use this one instead of .

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.StartOfYourEveryTurn
member.summary: Happens at the beginning of all of your turn. This means, if you delay, this can happen twice, three times or even an arbitrary number of times per combat round. Use this for ephemeral and background effects, where you don't care how many times they're activated.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ProvideContextualAction
member.summary: Returns a new action that you can perform as a "contextual action". If you return null, no new possibility is added to the "Contextual actions" section. Possibilities are regenerated at each state-check.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ProvideActionIntoPossibilitySection
P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ProvideSectionIntoSubmenu
P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ProvideMainAction
member.summary: Returns a new action that you can perform as a "main action". If you return null, no new possibility is added to the "Main actions" section. Possibilities are regenerated at each state-check.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouDealDamage
member.summary: Happens just after you (as ATTACKER) use the COMBAT ACTION to deal at least 1 damage to TARGET .

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouDealDamageOfKind
member.summary: Happens just after you (as ATTACKER) use the COMBAT ACTION to deal at least 1 damage that is DAMAGE KIND to TARGET .

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouAreDealtDamageOfKind
member.summary: Happens just after an ATTACKER uses the COMBAT ACTION to deal at least 1 damage that is DAMAGE KIND to YOU.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.StateCheck
member.summary: Happens as a state-based effect, modifies numbers only and has no lasting effect on the battle.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.StateCheckWithVisibleChanges
member.summary: Happens as a state-based effect, and can potentially cause permanent changes to the battlemap.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.EndOfYourTurn
member.summary: Happens at the end of each of your turns.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.EndOfYourTurnBeneficialEffect
member.summary: Happens at the end of your turn if it's a final end-of-turn. Use this for once-per-round beneficial or neutral effects, such as rolling extra saves against paralyze or dominate, healing from positive attunement, moon phase shift of touch of the moon or the teleportation from blink. (If a player delays, this effect doesn't happen until they actually take their turn.) If you don't know whether to choose or , as a rule of thumb, ask yourself: "Will this trigger deal damage to me?" If yes, choose Detrimental, otherwise choose Beneficial.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.EndOfYourTurnDetrimentalEffect
member.summary: Happens at the end of your turn if it's a primary turn. Use this for once-per-round detrimental effects, such as environmental damage, persistent damage, effect damage from Aerial Boomerang, cloudkill movement, winter bolt, damage from positive attunement, thorn, and the like. (A player can't delay to prevent this effect from happening. It happens on the player's primary turn regardless of whether the player ends it normally or delays). If you don't know whether to choose or , as a rule of thumb, ask yourself: "Will this trigger deal damage to me?" If yes, choose Detrimental, otherwise choose Beneficial.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BonusToAllChecksAndDCs
member.summary: Returns a bonus or penalty that applies to all of your checks and DCs.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BonusToSkills
member.summary: Returns a bonus or penalty that applies to all of your skill checks and skill DCs with the SKILL.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BonusToSkillChecks
member.summary: Returns a bonus or penalty that applies to your skill checks with the given SKILL used in the COMBAT ACTION against a TARGET.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BonusToSpellSaveDCs
member.summary: Returns a bonus or penalty that applies to DCs of your spells.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BonusToPerception
member.summary: Returns a bonus or penalty that applies to your Perception checks and Perception DC.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BonusToSpellSaveDCsForSpecificSpell
member.summary: Returns a bonus or penalty that applies to the given SPELL's DC.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BonusToAbilityBasedChecksRollsAndDCs
member.summary: Returns a penalty that applies to all checks, rolls and DCs that are based on ABILITY, including damage.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BonusToAttackRolls
member.summary: Returns a bonus or penalty that applies to the main check of a COMBAT ACTION you take against DEFENDER (nullable). Despite the name, this applies to all active rolls, not just to attack rolls. If you want to limit yourself to just attack rolls, you must check for ".HasTrait(Trait.Attack)" on the combat action.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BonusToDefenses
member.summary: Returns a bonus or penalty that applies to your DEFENSE against the COMBAT ACTION(nullable).

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BonusToInitiative
member.summary: Returns a bonus or penalty that applies to all initiative rolls.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AdjustSavingThrowResult
member.summary: Transforms an original CHECK RESULT that you received from a saving throw against COMBAT ACTION into a new check result.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AdjustSavingThrowCheckResult
member.summary: Transforms an original CHECK RESULT that you received from a DEFENSE saving throw against COMBAT ACTION into a new check result.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AdjustActiveRollCheckResult
member.summary: Transforms an original CHECK RESULT that you received when you made an ACTIVE ROLL for a COMBAT ACTION against a TARGET into a new check result.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.IsFlatFootedTo
member.summary: Returns the reason why you are flat-footed to the CREATURE(nullable) that's attacking you with COMBAT ACTION(nullable); or null if you're not.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.PreventTargetingBy
member.summary: Returns a reason for why you are immune to being targeted by the COMBAT ACTION. If you're not immune, returns null.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.PreventAreaAttacksAgainstMe
member.summary: If you're issuing a magical compulsion that prevents spells that include you in the area of effect from being cast against you, return true.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.PreventTakingAction
member.summary: Returns the reason for why you can't take the COMBAT ACTION, or null if you can.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.FizzleIncomingActions
member.summary: Causes a COMBAT ACTION performed against you to expend resources but have no effect against you if this returns true. It may still affect other targets. The check, if any, is written to the STRING BUILDER.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.FizzleOutgoingActions
member.summary: Causes a COMBAT ACTION that you perform to expend resources but have no effect at all if this returns true. The check, if any, is written to the STRING BUILDER.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouMakeAttackRoll
member.summary: This happens after you make an attack roll. This means an attack roll specifically, not just any active roll.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouMakeSavingThrow
member.summary: This happens after you make a saving throw against COMBAT ACTION with the given RESULT, but before any effects of that saving throw happen.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.EndOfAnyTurn
member.summary: This happens at the end of each creature's turn.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouTakeHostileAction
member.summary: This happens after you take a hostile COMBAT ACTION.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouTakeAction
member.summary: This happens after you take a COMBAT ACTION.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouExpendSpellcastingResources
member.summary: This happens after you expend spellcasting resources to cast a SPELL (this happens before the spell takes effect).

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouTakeActionAgainstTarget
member.summary: This happens after you resolve the effect of your COMBAT ACTION against a TARGET CREATURE, with CHECK RESULT on the main active roll or save. This event will trigger for each target of the action.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouAreTargeted
member.summary: This happens after the COMBAT ACTION that includes you as a target resolves.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouTakeDamage
member.summary: This happens after you take AMOUNT of damage (which consists primarily of DAMAGE KIND, but could contain other damage kinds as well) from a COMBAT ACTION and you know WHETHER IT CAME FROM A CRITICAL HIT. If you need to know specifically ALL the damage kinds dealt to you, use instead.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouTakeAmountOfDamageOfKind
member.summary: This happens after a COMBAT ACTION(nullable) deals at least AMOUNT damage (at least 1) that is DAMAGE KIND to you.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouTakeDamageOfKind
member.summary: This happens after a COMBAT ACTION(nullable) deals at least AMOUNT damage (at least 1) that is DAMAGE KIND to you.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.SightReductionTo
member.summary: All creatures and objects are at most this visible to you, and never more visible.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.WhenProvoked
member.summary: Triggers when a nearby enemy provokes an attack of opportunity by using a COMBAT ACTION.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ImmuneToCondition
member.summary: The owner of this QEffect can't get and is immune to all QEffects with this ID.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.DoNotShowUpOverhead
member.summary: If true, then this qeffect's name won't show up as an overhead when a creature receives it. Usually, you would use this when the effect's name is the same as the name of the personal spell that was just cast.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.WhenExpires
member.summary: Triggers after this qeffect is removed from its owner for any reason.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.WhenMonsterDies
member.summary: Triggers after the owner dies. When this triggers, the owner is still on the battlefield, likely with 0 HP. It will only be removed at the next state-check.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BeforeYourSavingThrow
member.summary: Triggers just before a COMBAT ACTION would cause YOU to roll a saving throw.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BeforeYourActiveRoll
member.summary: Triggers just before your COMBAT ACTION would cause you to roll a attack roll or other roll against a TARGET.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ProvideStrikeModifier
member.summary: Returns the combat action that's like a Strike that you can perform for the given ITEM.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ProvideStrikeModifierAsPossibility
member.summary: Returns a possibility that's to be added into the submenu of an ITEM.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ProvideStrikeModifierAsPossibilities
member.summary: Returns zero or more possibilities that are to be added into the submenu of an ITEM.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BonusToDamage
member.summary: Returns a bonus or penalty to damage that's being dealt by a COMBAT ACTION you're taking against the DEFENDER.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AddExtraWeaponDamage
member.summary: Returns extra damage that would be dealt by a WEAPON's Strikes.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AddExtraStrikeDamage
member.summary: Returns extra damage that would be dealt by your COMBAT ACTION that's a Strike against a TARGET (or null, if no extra damage). You can also use which is more powerful.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AddExtraKindedDamageOnStrike
member.summary: Returns extra kinded damage that would be dealt by your COMBAT ACTION that's a Strike against a TARGET (or null, if no extra damage).

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.YouAreTargeted
member.summary: Happens when you're a target of COMBAT ACTION, just before that action would cause a roll against you.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ProvideFortuneEffect
member.summary: Depending on whether a d20 roll IS A SAVING THROW, returns the reason why it benefits from a fortune effect, or null if it doesn't.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.MetamagicProvider
member.summary: This QEffect is a capability to perform metamagic.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.DetermineMainCheckResult
member.summary: This is a function meant for tutorial and cutscenes. If not null, it overrides the results of all main checks performed by this creature. For this to work, this QEffect must have the ID .

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.WhenCreatureDiesAtStateCheckAsync
member.summary: Triggers during the state-check when this creature is destroyed, just before it's removed from the battlefield and made into a corpse.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BonusToSelfHealing
member.summary: If the owner is affected by a HEALING ACTION(nullable!), that healing action gets the given BONUS to the healing.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.HalveHealingFromEffects
member.summary: If the owner is affected by a HEALING ACTION(nullable!), the healing action's healing MAY BE divided by two.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AdditionalUnarmedStrike
member.summary: Grants the given item as an extra unarmed attack.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.StartOfCombat
member.summary: Triggers at start of combat, just after the opening cutscene ends, after initiative rolls are made but before the initiative order is set up, before the first turn of the first creature.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.StartOfCombatBeforeOpeningCutscene
member.summary: Triggers at start of combat, just as the opening cutscene begins, after initiative rolls are made but before the initiative order is set up, before the line of the opening cutscene, and before and before the very first state-check.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.EndOfCombat
member.summary: Triggers at end of combat, just after the closing cutscene ends for an encounter. The boolean is "true" if the player won the encounter. The game loop ends immediately after this. This triggers even if this creature is dead by this point or otherwise no longer exists.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ProvidesArmor
member.summary: While you have this effect, you count as wearing this armor instead of whatever base armor you have.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.LimitsDexterityBonusToAC
member.summary: If this is not -1, then your dexterity bonus to AC is capped to this number or less.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.YouAreTargetedByARoll
member.summary: Triggers when a COMBAT ACTION with the CHECK BREAKDOWN RESULT might cause you to become affected, and returns true if the roll evaluation should be repeated, with the same natural d20 number. Use this event when you want to adjust the defenses of the target in response to an attack roll being known, e.g. Reactive Shield.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.DoNotUseResistancesAndImmunitiesAgainst
member.summary: When a COMBAT ACTION deals damage to you, this returns true if your resistances and immunities should be ignored for that damage.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.StartOfSourcesTurn
member.summary: Triggers at the beginning of the turn of the creature who created this QEffect, just before it would expire (if it expires at the beginning of the source's turn). This triggers even if the creature no longer exists. This triggers only on a creature's primary turn.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.YourStrikeGainsDamageType
member.summary: When you make a STRIKE, it deals its normal damage type or the damage type returned by this method, if it's worse for the target.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouAcquireEffect
member.summary: Triggers after you acquire a new QEFFECT. (The first QEffect is this one; the second one is the one you've just acquired.)

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.IncreaseCover
member.summary: When a COMBAT ACTION targets you and you have COVER KIND from it, instead that cover increases to the cover kind you return from this.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.RepresentsPoison
member.summary: True if this QEffect is a poison affliction that does something every round.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.YouBeginAction
member.summary: Triggers as you begin to take the COMBAT ACTION, just after any attacks-of-opportunity resolve

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ReducesPersistentDamageRecoveryCheckDc
member.summary: When you'd roll a recovery check to get rid of persistent damage, then THIS QEFFECT determines whether THE PERSISTENT DAMAGE QEFFECT which inflicts DAMAGE KIND damage will have its DC reduced by 5. This is cumulative with the DC decrease granted by assisted checks. This is meant for abilities such as the Charhide Goblin heritage.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.Affliction
member.summary: This QEffect is associated with this poison.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.SetBaseSpeedTo
member.summary: If this is not -1, then this creature's base speed becomes this number.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BattleformMinimumStrikeModifier
member.summary: If this is not 0, then this creature's minimum attack modifier is this number, unless its own modifier is greater.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.BattleformMinimumAthleticsModifier
member.summary: If this is not 0, then this creature's minimum Athletics modifier is this number, unless its own modifier is greater.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouAreHealed
member.summary: Triggers after you are healed by a COMBAT ACTION for AMOUNT of HP, which is at least 1.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.YouHaveCriticalSpecialization
member.summary: When you inflict a critical hit with a WEAPON using A STRIKE against a DEFENDER, does it trigger the critical specialization effect of the weapon?

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ConvertAllOutgoingDamageToDamageKind
member.summary: If not null, then all damage caused by this creature is dealt as damage of this damage kind instead.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.YouAreDealtDamageEvent
member.summary: Triggers when you're dealt damage by a DAMAGE EVENT, after all resistances apply and resolved damage is calculated, but before the damage is dealt. You may update here.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.YouDealDamageEvent
member.summary: Triggers when you're dealing damage using a DAMAGE EVENT, just as bonuses are being added up, before the DAMAGE EVENT is performed on the target. You may update the damage event here, before damage is resolved.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.RerollSavingThrow
member.summary: Triggers when you roll a saving throw with BREAKDOWN RESULT against a COMBAT ACTION. The returned value determines whether you should reroll the saving throw.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.RerollActiveRoll
member.summary: Triggers when you roll an active roll, such as an attack roll, with BREAKDOWN RESULT using a COMBAT ACTION against TARGET. The returned value determines whether you should reroll the active roll.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.CharacterSheetBecomesCreature
member.summary: Triggers when the CHARACTER SHEET is transformed into the CREATURE as part of , near the end, after the creature is entirely constructed.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AdjustDiceFormulaForSelfHealing
member.summary: Triggers when you're receiving healing from a COMBAT ACTION(nullable) that would restore DICE FORMULA hit points. Instead, it restores the returned DICE FORMULA of hit points. This trigger is meant to be used to add additional dice to the healing.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AfterYouTakeIncomingDamageEventEvenZero
member.summary: Triggers when a DAMAGE EVENT would be applied to you, after all damage calculation, and **even if** the damage event was reduced to zero. This is useful for oozes who use it to split, or if you need more information about the damage than what and and provide.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.CountsAsBeneficialToSource
member.summary: This QEffect should expire at end of the source's turn if the source delays and this effects is .

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.LongTermEffectDuration
member.summary: If this is not , then this represents a long-term effect that doesn't expire at end of encounter. These effects use special code, see .

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.SpawnsAura
member.summary: If not null, then when this QEffect is added to a creature, this immediately runs and if it creates an aura animation, that animation is added to the creature and it remains available from this QEffect as . Further, the aura's owner QEffect is set to this, and the aura is set to expire immediately when this QEffect expires.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AssociatedAura
member.summary: An aura animation whose lifecycle is bound to this QEffect.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.ThisCreatureCannotBeMoreVisibleThan
member.summary: This effect limits that this creature cannot be made more visible than this. How it's seen by others is always to reduced to this or worse. For example, this may be set to Concealed by a fog effect.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.StateCheckLayer
member.summary: The state-check happens in two layers. Some operations take effect in layer 0. Some operations take effect in layer 1. In almost all cases, you don't need to modify this and can keep your state-check effect at layer 0. However, for some effects, you may want to put them in layer 1 so that they are executed after effects in layer 0, to ensure the order of resolution of those effects.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AddGrantingOfTechnical(System.Func{Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature,System.Boolean},System.Action{Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect})
member.summary: Adds a state-check action to this QEffect which grants an ephemeral technical QEffect to some or all creatures on the battlefield.
member.param: Filter for which creatures should be given the technical QEffect.
Set up the properties for the technical QEffect.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect.AddGrantingOfTechnical(System.Func{Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect,Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature,System.Boolean},System.Action{Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffect})
member.summary: Adds a state-check action to this QEffect which grants an ephemeral technical QEffect to some or all creatures on the battlefield.
member.param: Filter for which creatures should be given the technical QEffect.
Set up the properties for the technical QEffect.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.Slowed
member.summary: The effect owner does not regain a number of actions at the start of their next turn equal to the value of this QEffect.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.IgnoresDifficultTerrain
member.summary: This effect causes the owner to ignore difficult terrain.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.IntimidatingGlare
member.summary: The effect owner does not take a penalty to Intimidation checks against creatures that do not speak Common.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.Diehard
member.summary: The effect owner dies at dying 5 instead of dying 4, if they're of the player faction.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.Fleeing
member.summary: The effect owner must spend all actions to move away from this QEffect's source as expediently as possible.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.FeatherStep
member.summary: The effect owner can use the step action to enter difficult terrain.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.ScoundrelRacket
member.summary: When you successfully Feint, the target is flat-footed against melee attacks you attempt against it until the end of your next turn. On a critical success, the target is flat-footed against all melee attacks until the end of your next turn, not just yours.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.CannotTakeReactions
member.summary: The effect owner will always return as being unable to take a reaction when another ability checks if they're eligable to do so.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.Mobility
member.summary: The effect owner won't provoke attacks of opportunity so long as they don't move more than half their speed when striding.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.BlindFight
member.summary: The effect owner doesn't need to succeed at a flat check to target concealed creatures. They're not flat-footed to creatures that are Hidden from them. They only need a successful DC 5 flat check to target a Hidden creature.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.Flying
member.summary: This effect causes the owner to ignore difficult terrain, among other things, such as ignoring Grease.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.RangersCompanion
member.summary: This effect represents that this creature is an animal companion. It may be a ranger's companion or a druid's companion, or even granted by a modded class or archetype.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.IgnoresWeb
member.summary: This effect causes allows the owner to ignore web tileQEffects.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.Sloth
member.summary: At the start of each of the effect owner's turns, roll 1d4. The result is the number of actions they regains that turn (maximum 3). Effects like the slowed condition can further reduce their number of actions.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.DirgeOfDoomFrightenedSustainer
member.summary: For as long as you have this QEffect, your frightened condition cannot be reduced below 1.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.HideInPlainSight
member.summary: The effect owner can take the Hide action without any special condtions, such as having the concealed QEffect.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.Swimming
member.summary: The effect owner can move through deep and shallow water tiles without penalty, and gets reduced penalties during Aquotic combat levels.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.FleeingAllDanger
member.summary: The effect owner must spend all actions to move away all enemy creatures as expediently as possible.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.PowerfulFist
member.summary: The effect owner removes the NonLethal trait from their default unarmed attacks.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.NimbleCrawl
member.summary: The effect owner can move up to half their speed instead of just 1 space when they take the Crawl action.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.PowerfulLeap
member.summary: The effect owner can move an extra tile when they use the Leap action.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.SwiftSneak
member.summary: The effect owner can move up to their full speed while sneaking, instead of only half their speed.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.KipUp
member.summary: The effect owner can stand as a free action, and doing so doesn't provoke attacks of opportunity.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.Incorporeal
member.summary: The effect owner can pass through enemy creatures.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.FreedomOfMovement
member.summary: The effect owner ignores effects that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed; and they automatically succeed on all attempts to Escape.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.AllAroundVision
member.summary: The effect owner cannot be flanked.

member.name: F:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.QEffectId.FogVision
member.summary: The effect owner ignores effects that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed; and they automatically succeed on all attempts to Escape.
