member.name: T:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Treasure.ItemModifications
member.summary: Holds custom modifications for items.
Registers a new type of item modification that can be afterwards applied to items.
member.param: This has largely no effect and is only used for debugging.
If this modification needs to be serialized into a save file or character library, how will it be serialized?

Loading this modification using or loading it from a save file or character library will produce a result here. The first argument is the serialized text. If it doesn't match what you expect, return null: the modification is probably registered by someone else. The second argument is the kind you must use in the returned modification.
member.returns: The unique modification kind that was created for this registration. You probably don't need to use this.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Treasure.Item.CannotDrinkBecause
member.summary: If a drink or administer action wants to administer a potion to a TARGET CREATURE, then this returns null if it's possible or a reason why it isn't, in the form of a sentence fragment that goes in "You can't drink this because you are FRAGMENT-HERE."

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Treasure.Item.StoresItem
member.summary: Returns null if THIS ITEM is capable of storing a SUBITEM within itself. If it's not, returns reasoning for this item is not capable of storing the subitem.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Treasure.Item.AfterModifiedWithModification
member.summary: Triggers after THIS ITEM is updated to account for the ITEM MODIFICATION.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Treasure.Item.ProvidesItemAction
member.summary: If a CREATURE is holding this ITEM in their hands, then that creature can use the returned possibility as an item action. If this is null or if it returns null, then no extra item action will be added as a possibility to the creature.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Treasure.Item.IsWorn
member.summary: This is set to "true" as a combat begins if this item is designated as a worn item in the backpack. This is always false while looking at the inventory outside of an encounter. In those cases, use instead.

member.name: P:Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Treasure.RuneProperties.CanBeAppliedTo
member.summary: If this is not null, then this RUNESTONE can be applied to an ITEM only if this method returns null (the first parameter is the runestone; the second is the item). If this method doesn't return null, then it returns the reason why the runestone can't be applied to the item.

member.name: T:Dawnsbury.Display.Illustrations.ModdedIllustration
member.summary: Represents a user-supplied or mod-supplied .png file in the CustomMods folder.
member.param: Filename of a .png file that's in the CustomMods folder, including extension and subfolder path, for example "AcidicBurst.png" for a file that's in the CustomMods folder itself, or "myModImages/AcidicBurst.png" for a file that's in the "myModImages" subfolder. These filenames are shared AMONG ALL MODS, so consider using a filename that's unlikely to collide with the filename of any other user. Putting all of your art in a subfolder named after your mod, for example, is a good idea.

member.name: T:Dawnsbury.Modding.DawnsburyDaysModMainMethodAttribute
member.summary: Each mod must have exactly one public static method annotated with this attribute. The method may be in any class. When Dawnsbury Days starts up, it will invoke this method of each loaded mod. The method must have return type void and no parameters.

member.name: T:Dawnsbury.Modding.LoadOrder
member.summary: Helper class that ensures everything is loaded in the proper order to not crash the game on start up due to circular references. For example, it ensures that feats are applied to creatures only after all feats are loaded, to avoid errors during the initial static initialization of classes.

member.summary: Triggers .

member.name: T:Dawnsbury.Modding.LoadOrderDelegated
member.summary: Separate class to avoid static initialization circular load problems.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.AddFeat(Dawnsbury.Core.CharacterBuilder.Feats.Feat)
member.summary: Registers a new feat and all its subfeats so that they show up in the character builder.
member.param: A new custom feat to register.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.RegisterTrait(System.String,Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Enumerations.TraitProperties)
member.summary: Registers a new with the given name and optionally additional properties and returns it. A mod that adds a new trait (such as a mod that creates a new ancestry and adds a trait representing that ancestry) should call this method only once and use the returned trait everywhere where needed. A second and third call to this call with the same trait name will return the same instance, but only the first call will register the , if any.
member.param: Human-readable name of the new trait.
Some traits can have additional properties and you can optionally supply them here.
member.returns: The singleton instance of the newly created trait.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.RegisterFeatName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new unique that uniquely identifies a modded feat. Use the return value of this method as the first argument of a 's constructor, and then you can also use it to refer to that feat in code.
member.param: The feat will be serialized and deserialized in save files and character libraries under this name. If you're changing an existing feat created with and into a feat created with , then this name must be the exact same string you previously placed into , otherwise existing save files and character profiles will break.

Optionally, you can set up an alternate display name of the feat here, which will not affect serialization into save files. If you put null or omit this parameter, the feat will be displayed under its technical name.

member.summary: Replaces a built-in spell with your own spell definition.
member.param: Spell to be replaced. The original description and code of the spell will not be used.
The new minimum spell level of this spell. Use the minimum spell level "0" if this spell is a cantrip.

A factory method that creates a new instance of the spell. Make sure to create a new instance instead of always returning the same one. The arguments to the factory method are the CASTER, the SPELL LEVEL this spell has been heightened to, WHETHER THE INSTANCE IS USED IN COMBAT, as opposed to whether it's only to be shown in the character builder (you can use this property to hide parts of the description that are irrelevant during combat, such as heightening text), and SPELL INFORMATION ABOUT THE SOURCE OF THE SPELL. Use the method to create the base of the spell.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.RegisterActionOnEachSpell(System.Action{Dawnsbury.Core.CombatActions.CombatAction})
member.summary: Register an action that will be called for each spell as it's created. You can use this API endpoint to make minor changes to existing spells, such as changing what they target, their goodness for the purposes of enemy tactics, their name and description etc.
member.param: An action that will be performed on all spells as they're created.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.RegisterActionOnEachKineticistImpulse(System.Action{Dawnsbury.Core.CombatActions.CombatAction})
member.summary: Register an action that will be called for each kineticist impulse as it's created. You can use this API endpoint to make minor changes to existing impulses, such as changing what they target, their goodness for the purposes of enemy tactics, their name and description etc.
member.param: An action that will be performed on all kineticist impulses as they're created.

member.summary: Registers a new spell if it doesn't already exist.
member.param: A unique identifier of this spell. If a spell with this identifier already exists, then this method will do nothing and instead the spell ID of that spell will be returned instead. If this is not what you want, consider instead.
The minimum spell level of this spell. Use the minimum spell level "0" if this spell is a cantrip.

A factory method that creates a new instance of the spell. Make sure to create a new instance instead of always returning the same one. The arguments to the factory method are the AUTO-GENERATED ID (which you can use to refer to the spell in any created QEffects if you need to), the CASTER, the SPELL LEVEL this spell has been heightened to, and WHETHER THE INSTANCE IS USED IN COMBAT, as opposed to whether it's only to be shown in the character builder (you can use this property to hide parts of the description that are irrelevant during combat, such as heightening text). Use the method to create the base of the spell.
member.returns: An auto-generated ID of the new spell; or the spell ID of an existing spell if it already exists.

member.summary: As , except that if the spell already exists (e.g. because it was added by the base game or in another mod), then this method will throw an exception.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.RegisterNewKineticistImpulse(System.String,System.Func{Dawnsbury.Core.CharacterBuilder.Feats.FeatName,Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature,Dawnsbury.Core.CombatActions.CombatAction})
member.summary: Registers a new kineticist impulse.
member.param: A unique identifier of this impulse. It will be used as the technical name of the impulse feat in save files, as well as the feat's display name.

A factory method that creates a new instance of the impulse. Make sure to create a new instance instead of always returning the same one. The argument to the factory method is the AUTO-GENERATED FEAT NAME (which you should supply to the method which you should use to create the impulse. In the factory method, you should call to create a base for the impulse, adjust the returned combat action and return it.
member.returns: An auto-generated ID of the new impulse.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.RegisterActionOnEachCharacterSheet(System.Action{Dawnsbury.Core.CharacterBuilder.CharacterSheet})
member.summary: Registers an action that will be applied to each player character sheet during the Recalculate method just after the pre-level-1 choices are added (ancestry, background, class). You can use this to, for example, add extra choices to be made at some levels.
member.param: An action that will be performed on each character sheet during its recalculation.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.RegisterActionOnEachCreature(System.Action{Dawnsbury.Core.Creatures.Creature})
member.summary: Registers an action that will be applied to each creature in an encounter just before that encounter begins. This applies to both player character creatures and to enemies. You can use this to, for example, add extra QEffects to some or all creatures.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.RegisterNewSoundEffect(System.String)
member.summary: Registers a new sound effect file, and returns a new instance that can be used to play that sound. If the same filename is registered multiple times, only the first registration counts, and subsequent registrations will returns the same value.
member.param: Name of the audio file, including relative path from the CustomMods folder and extension. For example, "AcidicBurst.wav" for a file in the CustomMods directory, or "AcidicBurstAssets/AcidicBurst.wav" for a file within the "AcidicBurstAssets" subfolder.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.RegisterNewMusic(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Registers a new music file, and returns a new instance that can be used to switch to that music. You must register each music file only once and you must do it before assets begin to load, that means, directly in your main mod method. It can't be done on the fly, all the music must be registered up front. All music is kept in memory throughout the lifetime of the application process.
member.param: Name of the audio file, including relative path from the CustomMods folder and extension. For example, "FantasyBackgroundLoop.mp3" for a file in the CustomMods directory, or "MyEvilCampaign/FantasyBackgroundLoop.mp3" for a file within the "CustomMods/MyEvilCampaign" subfolder.
A volume multiplier from 0 to 1. Most tracks should have a volume adjustment of around 0.1–0.3 to be at an appropriate volume compared to voice and sound effects and other music.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.RegisterEnumMember``1(System.String)
member.summary: Registers a new unique value for an arbitrary enum. You can use this to add additional s, s and other values. If you register them with this method they are guaranteed to be unique among all mods and they will be saved under their technical name rather than numerical ID so that they are properly serialized and deserialized in save files.
member.param: The string representation of the enum value.
member.typeparam: The enum type where you want to add an additional enum value.

member.summary: If the given ENUM VALUE is a modded enum value, this returns its technical name (e.g. "ConcordantChoir"). Otherwise returns null.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.RegisterNewItemIntoTheShop(System.String,System.Func{Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Treasure.ItemName,Dawnsbury.Core.Mechanics.Treasure.Item})
member.summary: Registers a new item to be available in the shop. If the item is a weapon, then this will also add the +1 variant and the +1 striking variant of the weapon to the shop.
member.param: Name under which the item will be saved into character sheets and save files.

A producer that creates a new instance of the item. The ITEM NAME is the unique technical identifier assigned to the new item you're registering, and is the same value as what is returned from this method.
member.returns: A unique identifier of the registered item.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.TryParse``1(System.String,``0@)
member.summary: If corresponds to the name of a base game or mod-registered enum member of the given type, then that enum member is returned in the second parameter and the method returns true; otherwise this method returns false. You can use this to check if, say, a FeatName or a SpellId already exists, but I don't recommend it because if two mods don't declare their dependency in Steam, you can't control their load order, so just because the FeatName or SpellId doesn't exist at the moment your mod registers doesn't mean it won't exist later on in the load process.
member.param: Serializable name of the enum member, such as "ConcordantChoir".
The enum member that already exists for that name and type.
member.typeparam: The enum type such as SpellId, FeatName or QEffectId.

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.ToStringOrTechnical``1(``0)
member.summary: Converts an enum to a string that can be used to represent it in serialized contexts, such as in FeatNames or ItemNames. For base game FeatName and ItemName instances, it returns their text, e.g. for ItemName.ModerateHealingPotion, this returns "ModerateHealingPotion". For modded feat names, it returns the technical string they were registered as, so for ModManager.RegisterFeatName("TechnicalName", "Human Name"), this returns "TechnicalName".

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.RegisterCustomTile(System.String,System.Action{Dawnsbury.Core.Tiles.Tile,Dawnsbury.Core.Tiles.Map,Dawnsbury.Campaign.Encounters.Encounter})
member.summary: Registers a new custom type of tile so that it can be used on custom encounter maps. For example, if you register the tile "Slime", you can also create a new tile in a tileset that will have the Id property set to "Slime". Then, when the game loads a map with a tile that includes a tile with Id, the game will apply the action on that tile. You can use it to, for example, add a new TileQEffect to that tile, which can for example deal acid damage to whoever steps on that tile and shows a pool of slime in its . If the registration already exists, it will be overwritten.
member.param: The "Id" property of the tile that you'll want to use from encounter maps.
This will be called on each tile where you place a tile with .

member.name: M:Dawnsbury.Modding.ModManager.RegisterEncounter``1(System.String)
member.summary: Registers a new encounter with the given filename. When the encounter is loaded from this filename, whether in story mode or free encounter mode, the encounter object will be an instance of the class TEncounter, which must have a constructor with a single string parameter which takes the filename. The filename should have no directory information and should be a plain filename of a .tmx file in a CustomMaps folder.
member.param: Simple filename of a .tmx file in a CustomMaps folder, e.g. "CustomGraveyard.tmx"
member.typeparam: Encounter type that will be instantiated where you can add additional code to the encounter.

member.summary: This method only exists in the V3 version of Dawnsbury Days. If your mod has a variant for both the V2 and V3 versions, call this when your code is set up for the V3 version to avoid accidentally compiling it against the V2 version of the base game.
